clauses.title: Understanding the organization and its context
clauses.description: The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended result(s) of its quality management system.

clauses.title: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
clauses.description: The organization shall determine the interested parties that are relevant to the quality management system and the requirements of these interested parties.

clauses.title: Leadership and commitment
clauses.description: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the quality management system.

clauses.title: Actions to address risks and opportunities
clauses.description: When planning for the quality management system, the organization shall consider the issues referred to in 4.1 and the requirements referred to in 4.2.

clauses.title: Resources
clauses.description: The organization shall determine and provide the resources needed for the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the quality management system.

clauses.title: Control of documented information
clauses.description: Documented information required by the quality management system and by this International Standard shall be controlled to ensure it is available and suitable for use.

clauses.title: Operational planning and control
clauses.description: The organization shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements.

clauses.title: Requirements for products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall ensure that the requirements for the products and services to be offered to customers are determined.

clauses.title: Design and development of products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall establish, implement and maintain a design and development process that is appropriate to ensure the subsequent provision of products and services.

clauses.title: Production and service provision
clauses.description: The organization shall implement production and service provision under controlled conditions.

clauses.title: Release of products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall implement planned arrangements, at appropriate stages, to verify that the product and service requirements have been met.

clauses.title: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
clauses.description: The organization shall determine what needs to be monitored and measured, the methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation needed.

clauses.title: Internal audit
clauses.description: The organization shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on whether the quality management system conforms to the organization's own requirements.

clauses.title: Improvement
clauses.description: The organization shall determine and select opportunities for improvement and implement any necessary actions to meet customer requirements and enhance customer satisfaction.

clauses.title: Non-conformity and corrective action
clauses.description: When a nonconformity occurs, the organization shall react to the nonconformity and take action to control and correct it.
